result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.
Concurrent with: with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Take all prescriptions as prescribed.
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee Artis Mclaurin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin not in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Department of Corrections on this date and forwarded to Court for review.

Defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Take all prescriptions as prescribed.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Documents in Support of the Defendant

Defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Katherine Seelow for Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Counts 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Randy P. Sitzberger for Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney John P Carlson in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel requests that case be called today.  Defendant failing to appear.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Lee Artis Mclaurin in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Ronald Dague for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As of August 3, 2015 due to Judicial Rotation this case will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or any dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (7/14/2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Attorney John P Carlson in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lee Artis Mclaurin
Current: 7500 N. Dean Road, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: 7828 West Villard Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 07-13-2015

Attorney John P Carlson in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-088

Statements to the Court regarding defendant's medical condition; defendant is presently hospitalized.

Court will order a stayed bench warrant and with no objection from the State, orders case adjourned for initial appearance in Branch CCCR.
